Fun fact for people reading this, Zed's Ult damage is a percentage of the damage done by his abilities. It calculates that damage straight from the damage of said abilities that are written in the description, not how much is dealt to the champion. So while irelia W mitigated the combo's raw damage, Zeds ult still calculated the damage it would have done if said abilities hit without a problem. If Irelia were to W the ult portion instead of when she as getting hit, then the Ult pop would be reduced. Please be informed.

The reason Zed's ultimate proc does as much damage as it did is because it calculates based off of unmitigated damage. It does not take the damage enemy actually took and then applies the percentage of that damage once again - this would be ridiculous when you think about it, as it would mean resistances are double as effective against Zed. I don't think Zed is in a very strong position atm, but I do agree that he needs some kind of work. A common complaint I hear is that zed kills someone too easily even when behind, but that is his role - assassin. The problem isn't that he is excelling at one thing he is supposed to do, it is that so much of the champion's identity is purely oriented around exactly that, and limits dynamic counterplay while also giving only limited role to the champion.
Zed R stores premitigation damage. I thought this was common knowledge by now.
